notes: Collection of pages from various comics series as an introduction to the work of the publisher and to the work of the various creators represented. Most series have brief descriptions and brief creator biographies.

Represented are: Eric Castel (Raymond Reding, Françoise Hugues) ; Pytha (Raymond) ; Dan Cooper (Albert Weinberg) ; Pharaon (Daniel Hulet, André-Paul Duchateau) ; Jeremiah (Hermann) ; Lieutenant Blueberry (Jean-Michel Charlier, Jean Giraud, Colin Wilson) ; Barbe-Rouge (Charlier, Jijé, Christian Gaty, Patrice Pellerin) ; Tanguy et Laverdure (Charlier, Jijé, Serres, Alexandre Coutelis) ; Buck Danny (Charlier, Francis Bergèse) ; Los Gringos (Charlier, Victor de la Fuente) ; Thaneros (Denis Parent, Claude Carre, Eric Larnoy) ; Jessica Blandy (Jean Dufaux, Renard) ; Tai-Dor (Rodolphe, Letendre, Jean-Luc Serrano) ; Francis Falko (François Corteggiani, De la Fuente) ; Michel Vaillant (Jean Graton) ; Julie Wood (Graton) ; Barracuda (Weinberg) ; Yalek (Duchateau, Jacques Géron) ; Colin Colas (Eddy Ryssack) ; Gigantik (V. Mora, Cardona) ; Les Gentlemen (Castelli, Tacconi) ; Tony Stark (Edouard Aidans)

143.heading: Editions Paquet.
143.title: The Final Flight
143.author: created and illustrated by Romain Hugault ; story and dialogs by Romain Hugault & Régis Hautière ; translator, Erik Svane.
notes: "1942-1945. Humanity is living in the darkest moments of the 20th century. While the earth shudders under bombs, the sky rages with combat. Among clouds lit by crossfire, men clash and fates collide. In the solitude of their cockpits, four pilots, each among their nations' finest, set off into darkened skies."
War genre, about World War II.
